pullrequest.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

content.raw:
Yes I was trying the same trick. It works when an outside event triggers it, but I didn't manage to make it work when the currently checked button is re-checked. Doing the trick on `buttonPress`, `buttonRelease` or `click`, I either end up with the button never being checked, or always being checked, I think it's because the `QButtonGroup` is firing its own events.

Tried also creating a hidden button to check when I want everything else unchecked and had the same problem.

I thought of adding some variable to keep track of the current mode and see when the same mode has been selected, or something like that.

Or maybe going back to the approach I have on commits 7d2a1d9 and 9bcf9a7 - firing events back and forth...
